channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Update to reference 8135090, 9th September
item.description:
Further to the above reference myself and my neighbour swept up all the debris and put it in a bag and into a pile on the street. The street has been cleaned but you have not taken the bag of debris. Can you please collect it? Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1-3, Wickham Road, Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Glass shards along cycle lane, 9th September
item.description:
Lots of broken glass all along the West Bank cycling lane. A section near the Dunsmure Rd end has a particularly large area of broken glass, which is difficult to avoid safely unless you cycle into the oncoming traffic lane.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): West Bank, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped junk, 9th September
item.description:
As above

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brooke Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pedestrian crossing unsafe, 9th September
item.description:
I have reported on the council website and fix my street. Both times i have recuved a response saying its not TFLs problem. Clearly there is an issue with the contact form if it keeps sending this issue to TFL. There are no other boxes to select which relate to road safety or traffic lights or pedestrain crossings. Please forward it to the relevant team or provide details of how I may do so. Several times already I have seen cars passing through a red light on this pedestrian crossing. The issue is that once the cars pass through the red traffic light (marked with a red line on the attached photo) there is nothing to indicate that they need to stop for the pedastian crossing. There needs to be a traffic light ON the pedestrian crossing (marked with a red circle on attached photo) AND yellow hatchings which prevent them from queueing between the existing traffic light and the pedestrian crossing. On one the occasion a van was stopped in the nearest lane and it hid us from the waiting cars and we did not see the cars put their foot down on the otherside of the van. They came passed the van at some speed just as we had stepped out (our pedestrain light was green). If we had come out passed the van we would have been hit. This is a crossing commonly used by children lots of whom are travelling alone (yesr 6 and secondary school). Bickley park school is opposite the crossing and bickley station is round the corner. Several times already I have seen cars passing through a red light on this pedestrian crossing. The issue is that once the cars pass through the red traffic light (marked with a red line on the attached photo) there is nothing to indicate that they need to stop for the pedastian crossing. There needs to be a traffic light ON the pedestrian crossing (marked with a red circle on attached photo) AND yellow hatchings which prevent them from queueing between the existing traffic light and the pedestrian crossing. On one the occasion a van was stopped in the nearest lane and it hid us from the waiting cars and we did not see the cars put their foot down on the otherside of the van. They came passed the van at some speed just as we had stepped out (our pedestrain light was green). If we had come out passed the van we would have been hit. This is a crossing commonly used by children lots of whom are travelling alone (yesr 6 and secondary school). Bickley park school is opposite the crossing and bickley station is round the corner.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, Page Heath Lane, Bickley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Mountbatten Close SE19 back of Fu Mi takeaway –, 9th September
item.description:
